구어체 (Colloquial).english: Yeah, yeah, sure (dismissive, not really listening/agreeing)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 잔소리가 길어지자 "아, 그래그래" 하며 넘겼다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: When the nagging went on too long, I brushed it off with 'yeah, yeah, sure.'

구어체 (Colloquial).english: That's laughable / Don't make me laugh (dismissive sarcasm)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 자기가 잘못하고 화를 내? 웃기고 있네.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You did something wrong and you're the one getting mad? Don't make me laugh.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Who do you think you're fooling? (lit: where are you selling medicine?)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 모른다고? 어디서 약을 팔어, 다 알면서.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You don't know? Who are you trying to fool — you know everything.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: What pretty words (sarcasm: they're saying something self-serving)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 본인 편한 대로 해 놓고 말을 참 예쁘게도 하네.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You did what suited you and now you phrase it so nicely.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: See, what did I tell you? (I-told-you-so)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 결국 이렇게 됐잖아. 그러게 내가 뭐랬어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: It ended up like this after all. See, what did I tell you?

구어체 (Colloquial).english: You really did great, great job (mocking/sarcastic when repeated)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 시험 전날 놀러 갔다고? 참 잘했다 잘했어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You went out to have fun the night before the exam? Great job, really.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: I'm sure you know best (sarcastic deference)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 아무 말도 안 통하네. 본인이 제일 잘 알겠지, 뭐.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Nothing I say gets through. I'm sure you know best.

구어체 (Colloquial).korean: 어쩜 그렇게 할 말만 골라 해
구어체 (Colloquial).english: How do you manage to say only what suits you?
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 자기 잘못은 쏙 빼고, 어쩜 그렇게 할 말만 골라 해.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: You conveniently leave out your own fault — how do you manage to say only what suits you?

구어체 (Colloquial).english: There are people watching, so... (warning to behave properly)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 보는 눈이 있으니까 조용히 해, 나중에 얘기하자.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: There are people watching, so keep it down — let's talk later.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: It's on a different level (can be genuine admiration or sarcastic)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 비싼 가방이 역시 격이 다르네.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: An expensive bag really is on a different level.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: What unexpected good fortune is this? (pleasant surprise)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 갑자기 보너스가 나왔어? 이게 웬 떡이야!
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: A bonus came out of nowhere? What unexpected fortune!

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Total mental breakdown (slang for extreme shock/confusion)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 면접에서 질문이 너무 어려워서 완전 멘붕이었어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The interview questions were so hard, I had a total mental breakdown.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: To be unable to conceal one's shock (formal-sounding but used colloquially for effect)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그 가격을 보고 경악을 금치 못했다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I was unable to conceal my shock when I saw that price.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: To be flabbergasted/dumbfounded
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 갑자기 해고 통보를 받아서 어안이 벙벙했다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I was flabbergasted after suddenly being notified of my dismissal.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: For one's jaw to drop (amazement)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 호텔 스위트룸에 들어가니 입이 딱 벌어졌다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: When I entered the hotel suite, my jaw dropped.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: I think I/they must be crazy (disbelief at something absurd)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 이 가격에 팔겠다고? 미쳤나 봐.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: They want to sell it at that price? They must be crazy.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: I've completely lost it / My mental state is gone (slang for being overwhelmed)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 실수를 연달아 해서 나 지금 멘탈 나갔어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I made one mistake after another — I've completely lost it.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Sudden mood killer (abbreviation of 갑자기 분위기 싸해짐)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그 말 한마디에 갑분싸 됐잖아.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: That one comment suddenly killed the mood.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: I just can't hold back what I have to say (insisting on speaking up)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 가만히 있으려고 했는데 할 말은 못 참겠어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I was going to keep quiet, but I can't hold back what I have to say.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: To not understand what's being said (implies someone is dense)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 몇 번을 말해도 말귀를 못 알아듣는다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: No matter how many times I explain, they don't get it.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Stop being unreasonable / Don't force it
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 안 되는 거 안 되는 거야, 억지 부리지 마.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: What can't be done can't be done — stop being unreasonable.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Honestly, isn't that a bit much? (inviting agreement)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 매번 자기만 빠지면서 솔직히 좀 그렇지 않아?
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: They skip out every time — honestly, isn't that a bit much?

구어체 (Colloquial).english: See? I was right (vindicating oneself)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 거 봐, 내 말이 맞잖아. 그때 들었으면 이렇게 안 됐어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: See? I was right. If you'd listened back then, it wouldn't have come to this.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: To put it bluntly / Cutting straight to it
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 딱 잘라 말하면, 그건 네 잘못이야.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: To put it bluntly, that's your fault.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: I'll give in / I'll make the concession, so... (conditional offer in argument)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 내가 양보할 테니까 다음부턴 이러지 마.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I'll give in this time, so don't do this again next time.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: It'd be better to just... (exasperated suggestion)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 이렇게 매번 싸울 바에야 차라리 따로 사는 게 낫다.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: If we're going to fight like this every time, we'd be better off living separately.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: First, calm down a bit, and then... (de-escalating)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 일단 좀 진정하고 천천히 얘기하자.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Calm down first, and let's talk slowly.

구어체 (Colloquial).korean: 그 정도면 됐지 뭘 더 바라
구어체 (Colloquial).english: That's more than enough — what more do you want?
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 이만큼 해 줬으면 그 정도면 됐지 뭘 더 바라.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: I've done this much for you — that's enough, what more do you want?

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Don't muddy the point / Don't change the subject
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 갑자기 딴 얘기 꺼내지 마, 논점을 흐리지 마.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Don't suddenly bring up something else — don't muddy the point.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Even conceding a hundred times over / Even giving the maximum benefit of the doubt
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 백 번 양보해서 네가 맞다 치더라도 방법이 잘못됐어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Even giving you the maximum benefit of the doubt, the method was wrong.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Did you happen to hear about that? (opening for gossip)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 영업팀 그 얘기 혹시 들었어? 완전 난리래.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Did you hear about the sales team? Apparently it's total chaos.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: According to them / They say... (secondhand storytelling)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 걔 말로는 회사에서 부당 대우를 받았대.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: According to them, they were unfairly treated at the company.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: This is a secret, but... (preface to sharing gossip)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 이건 비밀인데, 그 사람 이직 준비 중이래.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: This is a secret, but they say that person is preparing to switch jobs.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Keep this to yourself / Just between us
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 이거 나만 알고 있어, 아직 공식 발표 전이거든.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Keep this to yourself — it hasn't been officially announced yet.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: It was no joke / It was insane (emphasizing how extreme something was)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 어제 거기 사람 수가 장난이 아니었어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The number of people there yesterday was no joke.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: It turned out that... / As it turns out... (revealing a twist)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 알고 보니까 둘이 이미 예전부터 알고 지낸 사이였어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: As it turned out, the two of them had already known each other for a while.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: The atmosphere was not ordinary / Something seemed off
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 회의실에서 나올 때 분위기가 심상치 않더라.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: The atmosphere seemed off when they came out of the meeting room.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: After that, they/it completely changed
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 그 사건 이후로 걔 성격이 그 뒤로 완전 달라졌어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: After that incident, their personality completely changed.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: It's something that shouldn't be possible / It's unbelievable (storytelling emphasis)
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 같은 날 같은 장소에서 만날 줄이야, 있을 수가 없는 일인데.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Meeting at the same place on the same day — that's something that shouldn't be possible.

구어체 (Colloquial).english: Even from my perspective, it was a bit much
구어체 (Colloquial).example: 다른 사람이야 모르겠지만 내가 봐도 좀 심했어.
구어체 (Colloquial).example_en: Others might disagree, but even from my perspective, it was a bit much.
